title: Luke Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 22.

questions.question: What feast was approaching according to Luke 22:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Passover
questions.explanation: Luke 22:1 states that the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

questions.question: Who sought how they might kill Jesus because they feared the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Chief priests and scribes
questions.explanation: Luke 22:2 says the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him for they feared the people.

questions.question: Into whom did Satan enter, according to Luke 22:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Judas Iscariot
questions.explanation: Luke 22:3 states that Satan entered into Judas surnamed Iscariot.

questions.question: What did Judas do after Satan entered him?
options: Communed with the chief priests to betray Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Communed with the chief priests to betray Jesus
questions.explanation: Luke 22:4 explains Judas went to the chief priests and captains to betray Jesus to them.

questions.question: What did the chief priests promise Judas for betraying Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Money
questions.explanation: Luke 22:5 says they covenanted to give Judas money for his betrayal.

questions.question: Who did Jesus send to prepare the Passover meal?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter and John
questions.explanation: Luke 22:8 records Jesus sending Peter and John to prepare the Passover.

questions.question: Where were Peter and John instructed to find the place to prepare the Passover?
options: Follow a man bearing a pitcher of water
questions.correctAnswer: Follow a man bearing a pitcher of water
questions.explanation: Luke 22:10 instructs them to follow a man bearing a pitcher of water into a house.

questions.question: What did Jesus say the bread represents during the Passover meal?
options: His body which is given for you
questions.correctAnswer: His body which is given for you
questions.explanation: Luke 22:19 states Jesus took bread and said, 'This is my body which is given for you.'

questions.question: What did Jesus say the cup represents after supper?
options: The new testament in my blood
questions.correctAnswer: The new testament in my blood
questions.explanation: Luke 22:20 explains the cup is the new testament in Jesus' blood which is shed for you.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say was the one who would betray him?
options: The one whose hand is with me on the table
questions.correctAnswer: The one whose hand is with me on the table
questions.explanation: Luke 22:21 says the hand of him that betrayeth Jesus is with him on the table.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told Peter he would deny him three times before the cock crowed.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 22:34 records Jesus telling Peter he would deny him three times before the cock crowed.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed the servant's ear after it was cut off during his arrest.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 22:51 states Jesus touched the man's ear and healed him after it was cut off.

questions.question: True or False: Peter boldly confessed he was with Jesus when questioned by the maid.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 22:57 shows Peter denying he knew Jesus when the maid said he was with Him.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Father, if thou be willing, remove this ______ from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.'
questions.correctAnswer: cup
questions.explanation: Luke 22:42 has Jesus praying 'Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me.'

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is ______!'
questions.correctAnswer: betrayed
questions.explanation: Luke 22:22 says 'woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!'

medium.title: Luke Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with pride and wants to be recognized as the greatest in their church. Based on Luke 22, what principle about greatness should you share?
options: The greatest among you must be like the youngest, and the leader like the one who serves
The greatest should be honored with the highest position and authority
Only those with the most gifts should be considered the greatest
Greatness is determined by wealth and influence
questions.correctAnswer: The greatest among you must be like the youngest, and the leader like the one who serves
questions.explanation: Luke 22:24-27 teaches that true greatness is shown through humility and service, not by exercising lordship or seeking honor, emphasizing servant leadership.

questions.question: How does Luke 22 encourage believers to deal with temptation and trials?
options: By praying that you do not enter into temptation
By relying only on your own strength
questions.correctAnswer: By praying that you do not enter into temptation
questions.explanation: In Luke 22:40, Jesus instructs His disciples to pray so they do not fall into temptation, highlighting the importance of prayer and dependence on God during trials (Luke 22:40, 22:46, 22:31-32).

questions.question: When facing betrayal or hardship, what example of humility and trust can a believer learn from Jesus in Luke 22?
options: Jesus prayed, 'Not my will, but yours be done,' submitting to God's plan
Jesus demanded His rights and resisted arrest
Jesus ignored the situation and hoped it would resolve itself
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus prayed, 'Not my will, but yours be done,' submitting to God's plan
questions.explanation: Luke 22:42 records Jesus praying in submission to the Father's will, demonstrating humble trust and obedience even in suffering (Luke 22:41-44).

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to deny their faith under pressure. According to Luke 22, what encouragement can be given?
options: Though Peter denied Jesus, Jesus prayed for his faith to not fail and called him to strengthen others
Denying faith is unforgivable and means you are lost
You should avoid all situations where your faith might be tested
Only the strongest believers face temptation
questions.correctAnswer: Though Peter denied Jesus, Jesus prayed for his faith to not fail and called him to strengthen others
questions.explanation: Luke 22:31-32 shows Jesus praying for Peter's faith not to fail and encouraging him to strengthen his brothers, teaching hope and restoration after failure.

questions.question: What instruction does Jesus give about serving others that applies to Christian fellowship and church life?
options: The leader should serve others as an example of humility
Leaders should demand honor and respect from others
Serving others is optional for church leaders
Only the wealthy are called to serve
questions.correctAnswer: The leader should serve others as an example of humility
questions.explanation: Luke 22:27 teaches that Jesus, though the Master, was among His disciples as one who serves, setting a pattern for leadership and fellowship based on service and humility.

questions.question: How does Luke 22 teach about the importance of prayer before facing difficult circumstances?
options: Jesus prayed earnestly and was strengthened by an angel before His suffering
Prayer is not necessary before trials
Jesus avoided praying and relied on His own strength
Prayer only helps after the difficulty is over
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus prayed earnestly and was strengthened by an angel before His suffering
questions.explanation: Luke 22:43-44 shows Jesus praying with great earnestness and receiving divine strengthening before His passion, demonstrating prayer's vital role in spiritual preparation.

questions.question: What biblical truth about forgiveness and reconciliation is illustrated by Jesus’ response to Judas’ betrayal in Luke 22?
options: Jesus acknowledged the betrayal but did not retaliate, fulfilling God's plan
Jesus refused to speak with Judas
Jesus called down curses on Judas
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus acknowledged the betrayal but did not retaliate, fulfilling God's plan
questions.explanation: Luke 22:48-53 records Jesus facing Judas' betrayal calmly, asking about the kiss, and healing the servant's ear, showing forgiveness and submission to God's redemptive plan.

questions.question: A believer is seeking guidance about stewardship and preparedness. What teaching from Luke 22 can you share?
options: Jesus told His disciples to take a purse and sword as preparation for coming challenges
Believers should avoid having material possessions
Stewardship is not addressed in Luke 22
Believers should rely only on others for provision
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus told His disciples to take a purse and sword as preparation for coming challenges
questions.explanation: Luke 22:35-36 shows Jesus advising His disciples to be prepared materially for the difficult times ahead, emphasizing responsible stewardship and prudence.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 22, Jesus taught that spiritual leaders should exercise authority like kings over their followers.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 22:25-26 contrasts worldly rulers, who exercise lordship, with Jesus’ teaching that the greatest among His followers should be like the youngest and serve others humbly.

questions.question: How does Luke 22 illustrate the role of faith and restoration after failure in the life of a believer?
options: Peter denied Jesus but was restored through Jesus’ prayer and calling to strengthen others
Failure means permanent rejection by God
Failure is a sign of unworthiness
questions.correctAnswer: Peter denied Jesus but was restored through Jesus’ prayer and calling to strengthen others
questions.explanation: Luke 22:31-32 and 61-62 show Jesus’ prayer for Peter’s faith and Peter’s bitter weeping after denial, teaching restoration and hope after failure.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'This is my body which is given for you: this do in ______________ of me.'
questions.correctAnswer: remembrance
questions.explanation: Luke 22:19 records Jesus instituting the Lord's Supper, commanding His disciples to do this in remembrance of Him, emphasizing the importance of remembering Christ's sacrifice.

questions.question: What does Luke 22 teach about humility in the midst of trials and suffering?
options: Jesus submitted to the Father's will and prayed earnestly despite agony
Jesus demanded His rights and cursed His enemies
Jesus told others to fight their enemies physically
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus submitted to the Father's will and prayed earnestly despite agony
questions.explanation: Luke 22:41-44 shows Jesus praying with submission and earnestness in His agony, modeling humility and trust during suffering.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to forgive someone who wronged them. What example from Luke 22 could encourage them?
options: Jesus healed the servant's ear and did not retaliate against those arresting Him
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus healed the servant's ear and did not retaliate against those arresting Him
questions.explanation: Luke 22:50-51 shows Jesus responding to violence with healing and calm, teaching forgiveness and peace even when wronged.

questions.question: True or False: Luke 22 shows that Jesus was afraid and refused to face His betrayal and arrest.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 22:39-46 shows Jesus deliberately going to the Mount of Olives, praying, and submitting to God's will, demonstrating courage and obedience despite fear.

questions.question: How does Luke 22 teach about the importance of fellowship and unity among believers?
options: Jesus shared the Passover meal with His disciples desiring fellowship before His suffering
Believers should avoid gathering to prevent conflict
Fellowship is less important than individual prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus shared the Passover meal with His disciples desiring fellowship before His suffering
questions.explanation: Luke 22:14-15 records Jesus expressing desire to eat the Passover with His disciples, highlighting the value of fellowship and unity in the body of Christ.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 22.

questions.question: What event does Luke 22:1 indicate is approaching, and how is this event significant in both Jewish tradition and its fulfillment in the New Testament?
options: The Feast of Unleavened Bread, also called Passover
questions.correctAnswer: The Feast of Unleavened Bread, also called Passover
questions.explanation: Luke 22:1 states that the feast of unleavened bread, called Passover, drew near. This feast commemorates Israel's deliverance from Egypt (Exodus 12) and is significant as Jesus fulfills the Passover Lamb typology in His sacrifice.

questions.question: Who entered Judas Iscariot according to Luke 22:3, and what is the theological significance of this interaction?
questions.correctAnswer: Satan
questions.explanation: Luke 22:3 says Satan entered Judas Iscariot. This highlights the spiritual battle and the theme of evil influence in the betrayal of Jesus, consistent with New Testament portrayals of Satan as an adversary.

questions.question: In Luke 22:7-13, Jesus instructs Peter and John to prepare the Passover meal. What method does Jesus use to direct them, and what does this reveal about first-century Judean hospitality customs?
options: Following a man bearing a pitcher of water to a furnished upper room
Asking the chief priests for a location
Searching for a rented outdoor tent
questions.correctAnswer: Following a man bearing a pitcher of water to a furnished upper room
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs them to follow a man with a water pitcher to a furnished upper room (Luke 22:10-12). This reflects cultural norms where water-bearing was typically a woman's task, making the man identifiable, and upper rooms were used for important gatherings.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus' statement in Luke 22:19, 'This is my body which is given for you,' in the context of Jewish covenant language and New Testament theology?
options: It symbolizes the new covenant instituted through His sacrifice
It refers to a literal body part
It is a metaphor for the temple
It predicts the rebuilding of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes the new covenant instituted through His sacrifice
questions.explanation: In Luke 22:19, Jesus uses covenantal language reminiscent of the Passover lamb and sacrificial system, instituting the New Covenant by offering His body, fulfilling Old Testament typology (Jeremiah 31:31-34).

questions.question: How does Jesus contrast worldly leadership with His teaching on greatness among His disciples in Luke 22:25-27?
options: Worldly leaders exercise lordship, but His followers should serve one another
Worldly leaders are humble, but His followers should be powerful
Worldly leaders seek peace, His followers seek war
Worldly leaders are poor, His followers will be rich
questions.correctAnswer: Worldly leaders exercise lordship, but His followers should serve one another
questions.explanation: Luke 22:25-27 contrasts Gentile rulers who lord over others with Jesus’ call for His followers to be servants, emphasizing servant leadership as a key kingdom value.

questions.question: What is the meaning of Jesus' prayer in Luke 22:42, 'not my will, but thine, be done,' and how does this reflect the theme of submission in the Garden of Gethsemane?
options: Submission to God's sovereign will despite personal suffering
questions.correctAnswer: Submission to God's sovereign will despite personal suffering
questions.explanation: Luke 22:42 shows Jesus’ submission to the Father’s will, embodying the theme of obedience and surrender central to His passion and the Christian life.

questions.question: In Luke 22:31-32, what does Jesus mean when He tells Simon Peter that 'Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat,' and what Old Testament imagery does this evoke?
options: Satan seeks to test Peter severely like grain being sifted
Satan wants to bless Peter abundantly
Satan desires to feed Peter with wheat
Satan intends to protect Peter from harm
questions.correctAnswer: Satan seeks to test Peter severely like grain being sifted
questions.explanation: The sifting of wheat is an Old Testament metaphor (e.g., Zechariah 13:9) for purification through testing. Jesus warns Peter of intense spiritual testing by Satan.

questions.question: According to Luke 22:34, what prophecy does Jesus make about Peter, and how does this foreshadow Peter's actions later in the chapter?
options: Peter will deny Jesus three times before the cock crows
Peter will flee and never return
Peter will be the first to die for Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Peter will deny Jesus three times before the cock crows
questions.explanation: Jesus prophesies Peter's thrice denial (Luke 22:34), which is fulfilled in verses 56-60, showing the fulfillment of Jesus’ foreknowledge and human weakness.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus saying in Luke 22:20, 'This cup is the new testament in my blood,' especially considering the Septuagint usage of the Greek term 'diatheke' (testament/covenant)?
options: It establishes a new covenant through Jesus' sacrificial blood
It refers to a legal will for property
It predicts the destruction of the temple
It symbolizes a peace treaty with Rome
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes a new covenant through Jesus' sacrificial blood
questions.explanation: The Greek 'diatheke' (covenant/testament) in Luke 22:20 alludes to Jeremiah 31’s promise of a new covenant, fulfilled through Jesus’ sacrificial death.

questions.question: In the historical context of Luke 22:36, why does Jesus instruct His disciples to buy a sword, and how might this relate to the political tensions of the time?
options: To prepare for imminent danger amid growing hostility
To start a rebellion against Rome
To hunt for food in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: To prepare for imminent danger amid growing hostility
questions.explanation: Luke 22:36 reflects Jesus preparing His disciples for coming persecution and danger in a politically volatile Judea, though He does not advocate violence.

questions.question: How does Luke 22:43-44 describe Jesus' experience in the Garden of Gethsemane, and what is the theological significance of the 'drops of blood'?
options: Jesus' agony is so intense that sweat becomes like blood, showing human suffering
Jesus immediately accepts His fate without struggle
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus' agony is so intense that sweat becomes like blood, showing human suffering
questions.explanation: The description of sweat like blood indicates extreme distress (hematidrosis), emphasizing Jesus’ full humanity and the cost of atonement.

questions.question: What is the irony in Judas' act of betrayal described in Luke 22:47-48, and how does it contrast with the cultural meaning of a kiss in ancient Near Eastern society?
options: Judas betrays Jesus with a kiss, a sign of friendship and respect
Judas offers a gift instead of a kiss
questions.correctAnswer: Judas betrays Jesus with a kiss, a sign of friendship and respect
questions.explanation: In Luke 22:47-48, Judas uses a kiss—normally a greeting of affection—as a signal of betrayal, highlighting the treachery and hypocrisy.

questions.question: How does the denial of Peter in Luke 22:56-60 fulfill Jesus’ earlier prediction, and what does Peter's reaction in verse 62 reveal about his understanding?
options: Peter denies Jesus three times, then weeps bitterly, showing repentance
questions.correctAnswer: Peter denies Jesus three times, then weeps bitterly, showing repentance
questions.explanation: Peter fulfills Jesus' prophecy (Luke 22:34) by denying Him thrice and then weeping bitterly (22:62), indicating remorse and recognition of his failure.

questions.question: In Luke 22:69, what is the significance of Jesus' statement that the Son of Man will sit at the right hand of the power of God, and how does this connect to Old Testament Messianic expectations?
options: It affirms His Messianic authority and fulfillment of Psalm 110:1
It predicts His exile to a distant land
It refers to a political throne in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms His Messianic authority and fulfillment of Psalm 110:1
questions.explanation: Luke 22:69 alludes to Psalm 110:1, a key Messianic text, asserting Jesus' divine authority and role as Messiah seated at God's right hand.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 22:53, Jesus states that His arrest marks 'the hour and the power of darkness,' highlighting the cosmic spiritual conflict involved in His passion.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 22:53 explicitly mentions 'this is your hour, and the power of darkness,' indicating the spiritual and cosmic dimension of Jesus' arrest.

theological.title: Luke Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant event does the feast of unleavened bread, also called Passover, foreshadow in Christian theology?
options: The sacrificial death of Christ as the Lamb of God
The giving of the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: The sacrificial death of Christ as the Lamb of God
questions.explanation: Luke 22:1 introduces the feast of unleavened bread, the Passover, which in Christian theology symbolizes Christ as the Passover Lamb (1 Corinthians 5:7), who was sacrificed for the sins of the world (John 1:29). This connects to the Old Testament Passover where the lamb's blood saved Israel (Exodus 12:1-30).

questions.question: Who entered Judas Iscariot, prompting him to betray Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Satan
questions.explanation: According to Luke 22:3, Satan entered Judas, highlighting the spiritual battle and the reality of sin and evil's influence on human actions, consistent with themes in John 13:27 and 1 Peter 5:8.

questions.question: What was Jesus' attitude toward eating the Passover with His disciples before His suffering?
questions.correctAnswer: With desire
questions.explanation: Luke 22:15 shows Jesus expressing a deep yearning to share this meal, emphasizing the significance of fellowship and the impending fulfillment of salvation history, relating to John 13:1 and Hebrews 12:2.

questions.question: What did Jesus say the bread represented during the Last Supper?
questions.correctAnswer: His body given for them
questions.explanation: In Luke 22:19, Jesus identifies the bread as His body given for believers, a foundational doctrine of substitutionary atonement consistent with Isaiah 53:5 and 1 Corinthians 11:24.

questions.question: What is the significance of the cup Jesus shared after supper?
options: It is the new testament in His blood
It represents the waters of baptism
It is a symbol of peace
questions.correctAnswer: It is the new testament in His blood
questions.explanation: Luke 22:20 describes the cup as the new covenant sealed by Jesus' blood, marking the establishment of a new relationship between God and humanity, fulfilling Jeremiah 31:31-34 and Hebrews 9:15.

questions.question: How did Jesus describe the greatest among His followers?
options: As the one who serves others
As the one with the most authority
As the one who speaks the loudest
questions.correctAnswer: As the one who serves others
questions.explanation: Luke 22:26 teaches servant leadership, contrasting worldly power with the kingdom ethic, consistent with Mark 10:43-45 and Philippians 2:5-7.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the hand of the one who would betray Him?
options: It is with Him on the table
It will be rejected by God
It will be lifted in blessing
questions.correctAnswer: It is with Him on the table
questions.explanation: Luke 22:21 reveals the proximity of betrayal, emphasizing the sorrowful fulfillment of prophecy (Psalm 41:9) and the human responsibility in divine plans (Acts 2:23).

questions.question: What did Jesus pray about in the Garden of Gethsemane regarding the cup He was to drink?
options: If it be possible, let this cup pass from me
May it be filled with joy
Let the cup be shared with His disciples
questions.correctAnswer: If it be possible, let this cup pass from me
questions.explanation: Luke 22:42 captures Jesus’ submission to the Father's will despite the impending suffering, illustrating the doctrine of the incarnation and atonement (Philippians 2:8, Hebrews 5:7).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the disciples when Jesus found them after His prayer in Gethsemane?
questions.correctAnswer: They were sleeping for sorrow
questions.explanation: Luke 22:45 shows human frailty and the need for perseverance in prayer, consistent with Matthew 26:40-41 and Romans 7:15.

questions.question: How did Jesus identify Judas' act of betrayal?
options: Betraying the Son of Man with a kiss
Striking the servant of the high priest
questions.correctAnswer: Betraying the Son of Man with a kiss
questions.explanation: Luke 22:48 highlights the irony and treachery of Judas’ kiss, fulfilling Psalm 41:9 and emphasizing the human sinfulness and divine sovereignty.

questions.question: What did Peter do after Jesus was arrested, fulfilling Jesus' prediction?
questions.correctAnswer: Denied knowing Jesus three times
questions.explanation: Luke 22:60-62 recounts Peter’s denial, showing human weakness and grace, fulfilling Jesus’ prophecy and illustrating repentance (John 18:17, 1 John 1:9).

questions.question: What was the response of the religious leaders to Jesus' claim about His identity?
questions.correctAnswer: They accused Him of blasphemy
questions.explanation: Luke 22:70-71 shows the leaders’ rejection of Jesus' messianic claim, consistent with Mark 14:61-64 and Psalm 110:1, highlighting the conflict between Jesus and religious authorities.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the coming kingdom to His disciples at the Last Supper?
options: They would eat and drink at His table and sit on thrones judging Israel
They would rule over the Gentiles immediately
They would be given wealth and power
They would be exempt from suffering
questions.correctAnswer: They would eat and drink at His table and sit on thrones judging Israel
questions.explanation: Luke 22:29-30 promises participation in Christ’s kingdom, reflecting Old Testament messianic hopes (Daniel 7:13-14) and the eschatological reign in Revelation 3:21.

questions.question: What instruction did Jesus give about swords to His disciples?
options: If you have no sword, sell your garment and buy one
questions.correctAnswer: If you have no sword, sell your garment and buy one
questions.explanation: Luke 22:36-38 shows Jesus’ preparation for coming trials, also fulfilling Isaiah 53:12 about being counted among transgressors, indicating the necessity of readiness in spiritual and physical opposition.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the authority exercised by worldly kings compared to His followers?
options: Worldly kings exercise lordship and are called benefactors, but His followers must serve
His followers should exercise lordship over others
Worldly kings are examples to be emulated
His followers should avoid all authority
questions.correctAnswer: Worldly kings exercise lordship and are called benefactors, but His followers must serve
questions.explanation: Luke 22:25-26 contrasts worldly power with kingdom humility, consistent with Matthew 20:25-28 and Philippians 2:3-7, emphasizing servant leadership as the model for believers.
